title:
Traveling as a learning experience ☕️

Today I’m sowing you the story I captured around @combi_coffee while in Portugal a few weeks ago.

Traveling is a learning experience when talking about photography.

With or without your camera your eyes experience wonder and awe 🥹 you’ll never be the same person

When you are traveling you anchor yourself in the present and create space to observe

In those moments you encounter stories with a fresh perspective and open eyes

Visiting Combi Coffee a capturing a few moments there without caring about the end result, just admiring the beauty around coffee culture…

It made me feel in love with the place, the people and of course the coffee (one of my favorite by far)

Hope this inspire you to open your eyes and go outside to find the beauty around you, and of course to grab a cup of coffee ☕️

———
Gear
- Capture with Canon R5 - 100mm 2.8 - 28-70mm 2.0 by @canonespana @kinafoto
- Editing software: #LightroomMobile @lightroom
———

.

Viajar como experiencia de aprendizaje ☕️

Hoy les cuento la historia que capturé en @combi_coffee mientras estuve en Portugal hace unas semanas.

Viajar es una experiencia de aprendizaje cuando se trata de fotografía.

Con o sin tu cámara, tus ojos experimentan asombro y admiración 🥹 nunca volverás a ser la misma persona.

Cuando viajas, te anclas en el presente y creas espacio para observar.

En esos momentos te encuentras con historias con una perspectiva fresca y los ojos abiertos.

Visitar Combi Coffee y capturar algunos momentos allí sin importar el resultado final, solo admirando la belleza que rodea la cultura del café…

Me hizo enamorarme del lugar, la gente y, por supuesto, del café (uno de mis favoritos por diferencia).

Espero que esto te inspire a abrir los ojos y salir a buscar la belleza que te rodea y, por supuesto, a tomar una taza de café ☕️

#coffee #coffeeholic #porto #photography #foodphotography #coffeelover #travelphotography

title:
@combi_coffee is a specialty coffee roastery, located in Porto, Portugal. It all started in 2014 with an old Mercedes van that, for two years, brought specialty coffee to various stops, including festivals, markets and streets in and around Porto.

Since 2017 Combi has been a fixed-space coffee shop and also a factory where they roast green beans from different origins, both for consumption in house and for selling to their customers.

Always trying to improve themselves and their, coffee they roast, they are sourcing only great coffees for their customers. They are aiming to build relationships with the farmers and ensure they get paid a fair and high price for the coffee they produce.

This coffee shop is a strong candidate to be on the list THE WORLD’S 100 BEST COFFEE SHOPS. ☕️ 🤎

Stay tuned to our social networks to know the first list where you will find the best coffee shops from 100 to 1!!!🥇

#TheBestCoffeeShop #Top100 #CoffeeLovers #WorldsBestCoffeeShops #Coffee #combicoffee #Porto #Portugal

title:
bom dia! it’s roasting day at combi serralves. pass by if you want to see how the magic happens ☕️

R. Prof. Augusto Nobre 451 A
4150-119 Porto

@combi_coffee is a specialty coffee roastery founded by brothers Gonçalo and Francisco Cardoso, located in Porto, Portugal. It all started with an old Mercedes van that, for two years, brought specialty coffee to various stops, including festivals, markets, and streets in Porto and its surroundings.

In 2017, they opened their first coffee shops, where they also roast their own green coffee from different origins, both for home consumption and for sale to their customers. Combi’s goal is to build relationships with farmers and ensure they receive a fair and high price for the coffee they produce.

This coffee shop is a strong candidate to be on the list THE WORLD’S 100 BEST COFFEE SHOPS. ☕️ 🤎

Stay tuned to our social networks to know the first list where you will find the best coffee shops from 100 to 1!!!🥇

#TheBestCoffeeShop #Top100 #CoffeeLovers #WorldsBestCoffeeShops #Coffee #combi #Porto #Portugal

title:
did you know that coffee in it’s origin is a fruit? a coffee cherry contains one to two beans that get extracted and prepared in the country of their origin. when the beans arrive to our roastery they are green. only by roasting they change in color from green to yellow, caramel to the brown beans that you can buy in our shop.
roasting brings out the flavours the beans have inside. we try to roast the beans to their personal perfect level so we and you can enjoy the most out of them!

Meet Deri Kibele ☕️

Our latest Ethiopian 🇪🇹 A brew featuring delightful orange apricot notes – order online or try it at our shops with v60 or Aeropress.

Packing and roasting coffee for our subscribers 🙌📦

It’s that time of the month again, hectic, paced, but energetic. Full focus is needed to attend to all the orders for our subscribers! Orders being shipped Wednesday and Thursday

New in ☕️ Fábrica’s coffee cups ☕️

We’re excited to announce that Fábrica’s coffee cups are now available for pre-order! Made by IPA Porcellane, these sturdy, heavyweight cups feature a thick, durable glaze, designed to endure the demands of daily use in coffee shops. Perfect for your morning coffee, they’re built to last and offer an exceptional experience every day. Available in espresso and cappuccino size. Pre-orders are now open!

Our coffee subscription ☕️ is budget friendly, hassle-free, fresh and it adjusts to your needs - let us explain why!

What are the benefits of subscribing?
1. Be the first to try our coffees before they’re officially released.
2. Receive a curated bundle for the entire month—no need to choose!
3. Only €25.90 per month for two 250g bags—cheaper than buying individually.
4. Free shipping.
5. Option for custom requests—just reach out to us!

What are the available options?
• Choose between a Filter or Espresso bundle.
• Pick either two 250g bags of different varieties or four 250g bags (two of each variety).
• Subscribe for 3, 6, or 12 months—whatever suits you best.
• Select your ideal subscription plan on our website.

How does it work?
1. We roast the subscription coffee on the first Monday of each month.
2. Your coffee is shipped by the first Wednesday of the month.
3. To receive the subscription for the upcoming month, you need to sign up by the last Friday of the previous month.

Example:
• You subscribe to the 3-month plan on February 25th and make your first payment.
• On March 3rd (the first Monday of the month), we roast and pack your coffee.
• Your coffee is shipped between March 4th and 5th.
• The same process repeats in April and May.

If I subscribe on March 1st, will I still get March’s coffee?
No. Our subscription coffees are roasted and shipped only once per month, in the first week. To receive March’s coffee, you would need to have subscribed by the last Friday of February (Feb 28th in this case).
Since your subscription was placed after the cut-off, it will be scheduled for April’s batch. Your first coffee bundle will arrive in the first week of April.

Last Call for Subscription!

For this month’s subscription, we’ve gone all in on Ethiopian coffees—the birthplace of coffee, humanity, and one of our all-time favorite origins.

You can subscribe until February 28th through our website to receive this month’s selection. All coffees will be freshly roasted and shipped at the beginning of next week.

Espresso Selection:

☕ Ephtah, Ethiopia – This naturally processed Ethiopian coffee brings a sweetness reminiscent of dried apricot, a subtle acidity up front, and a smooth, delicate finish. It’s the espresso we’re currently serving in our cafés, and we couldn’t be happier with how it shines both black and with milk.

☕ Tablón de Gomez, Colombia – From the iconic Nariño region, known for its high altitudes and volcanic soils, this coffee boasts the creamy sweetness of milk chocolate with intriguing hints of pink pepper. Its smooth body perfectly showcases the flavors of its origin.

Filter Selection:

☕ Deri Kebele, Ethiopia – A delicate, fruit-forward profile with refreshing citrus notes, like orange. Sourced from the Guji region, this coffee offers a clean and bright cup, perfect for easy sipping.

☕ Lalesa Gedeb, Ethiopia – This naturally processed Ethiopian coffee has everything you’d expect from the origin: soft peach notes, a refined and tea-like mouthfeel, and a pleasant, lingering sweetness.

Want to dive deeper into Ethiopian coffee? Read our blog post, “Ethiopian Coffee: Taste, Tradition & Terroir”, to explore its rich history, traditions, and significance.

A journey to Ethiopia in every sip! 🇪🇹✨ Ephtah is on our espresso bar today, bringing bright flavors with notes of apricot and orange.

Visit any of our locations—open until 5 PM!

How is your Sunday going? ☀️🌊

How about a brunch with a sea breeze?

Check out our food menu at our store in Cascais and visit us every day until 5pm.

Every day, before the world wakes up, our bakery is already alive. ☀️

The ovens are lit, filling the air with the comforting scent of freshly baked bread. Our sourdough loaves, proofed since yesterday, are finally ready for the heat. The filling for our pastéis de nata is carefully prepared, along with our buttery quiches and pain au chocolat…

While the city sleeps, our bakers and pastry chefs work with care, using organic flour and high-quality ingredients to craft everything fresh for the day ahead.

So when morning comes, our shops open with displays full of golden, flaky croissants, warm pastéis de nata, and everything you need to start your day, paired, of course, with the perfect coffee.

title:
Dating back to the 1400s, when it served as one of Lisbon’s city gates, Rua das Portas de Santo Antão still holds some hidden gems. From the charming Casa do Alentejo, a 17th-century Moorish-inspired palace serving Alentejo delicacies, to the iconic Coliseu dos Recreios, one of the city’s oldest entertainment venues, there’s always something to discover.

At number 136, in the heart of it all, our first store was born. With a spacious interior and a cozy terrace, we’ve been serving specialty coffee here since 2015. Overlooking Largo da Anunciada and sitting right next to Lisbon’s oldest funicular, Elevador da Lavra, it’s the perfect spot for a morning break or an after-lunch coffee.

Spoons, cups, coffee… go! 🥄 ☕️

To go along with our latest blog article on coffee cupping, we’ve put together this step-by-step guide to coffee tasting. We hope it inspires you to try a cupping session this weekend.

Let us know in the comments: did you taste peach, chocolate, caramel… or something else? 🍑🍫🍌

Have you ever wanted to learn more about your coffee preferences? 🤔

In this week’s blog article, we’re focusing on cupping—the coffee tasting process. To help you get started on this journey, our “Beginner’s Guide to Coffee Cupping” breaks down how to taste coffee like a pro in a simple and concise way.

Read the full article via the link in our bio and check out our available coffees in our online store.

For everyone who feels like January is the longest month ever, hang in there — we’re almost there!

With the month wrapping up, here’s your reminder: there’s still time to join our subscription and receive the exclusive coffees we’ve prepared for February.

This month’s lineup offers something for everyone: comforting Brazilian classics and fun, fruity options across both espresso and filter.

Espresso Selections:

Lambari, Brazil: A super velvety and sweet espresso with soft nutty notes. This is the coffee we’re currently serving in all our shops, and it shines equally as a straight espresso or in milk-based drinks.

Ospina Microlot, Colombia: Floral and delicate with vanilla sweetness, yet rich with a silky body. It’s also a favorite for Moka Pot brewing among our team!

Filter Selections:

Nensebo, Ethiopia: Light and silky, with clean, fruity flavors and delicate floral notes of berries and white flowers. Expect a touch of gentle acidity.

Mantiqueira, Brazil: A sweet, nutty classic. As a staple of Brazilian pour-over culture, this coffee offers a warm and familiar filter profile.

Don’t miss out — subscribe now and let February start with a cup (or two!) of these incredible coffees.

Mondays in our warehouse are always bustling. Each department is busy with its own tasks: the bakery starts producing fresh pastries and sourdough bread as early as 3 a.m., the carpentry workshop handles all our custom demands, the office overlooks everything from the mezzanine, and our beloved roastery and logistics corner ensures smooth operations 🥸

title:
Since 2019, we’ve called Rua do Comércio home. With its natural light, cozy atmosphere, and a terrace overlooking the Sé Cathedral, this shop was the third to join our family.

Located in Baixa Pombalina — a historic neighborhood rebuilt after Lisbon’s great earthquake in the 18th century — the area is renowned for its innovative urban planning, elegant architecture, and pioneering anti-seismic design. It’s truly a must-see for anyone exploring the city.

Nestled between the vibrant Praça do Comércio and the Design Museum on Rua Augusta, our shop is the perfect spot to pause, relax, and enjoy a really good cup of coffee.

Pop in and come say hi to our team!

Tucked away from one of Chiado’s busiest streets, Rua do Alecrim, our Rua das Flores shop is a must-visit if you’re seeking a break from the rush of Baixa. ☕️🧘

In the autumn of 2016, we opened our second Fábrica Coffee Roasters location on the corner of this charming street. This historic road, famously featured in the works of renowned Portuguese author Eça de Queirós, also holds a chapter of Fábrica’s story. For eight years, our roastery operated at no. 63 Rua das Flores, where the scent of freshly roasted coffee became part of the neighborhood’s essence.

With the need for more space, our roastery relocated to Sintra, but the scent of coffee still lingers from Rua do Alecrim to Cais do Sodré.

Whether you’re seeking a midday coffee break, a quiet workspace, or simply catching up with friends, our Chiado shop offers the perfect setting.

title:
Last Friday, we gathered at the roastery to taste our coffees.

The cupping method, which we use for coffee evaluation, along with a consistent tasting routine, helps us assess the quality of our work, identify adjustments needed, and determine how to approach each coffee during roasting and brewing.

The main advantage of this method is its simplicity — it’s independent of brewing skills and can be used anywhere in the world, allowing everyone from the farm to the roastery to taste the same coffee.

Have you ever tried this method, or would you like to learn more about it?

📖☕ As we kick off the year, we’re diving into a big question in the coffee world: What’s driving the rising cost of specialty coffee?

In this article we break down the top three reasons and share how roasters, producers, and coffee lovers can navigate this challenge.

Read the full article through the link in our bio!

What are your thoughts on this subject? We’d love to hear from you! 👇

Another trip around the sun, filled with coffee and love☕☀️

With some challenges and intense moments, we’re closing 2024 with full hearts. This year, we celebrated our first anniversary at our roastery in Sintra and a year of handmade bread and pastries.

We couldn’t be more grateful to our incredible teams who made this year possible: our baristas, managers, production team, logistics crew, office staff, and bakery team. To all of you, we raise a toast to a new year full of joy and renewed energy.

We also want to express our sincere gratitude to our partners, those who chose our coffee to serve to their customers and trusted in its quality.

And, of course, a big cheers to all of you who shared a cup of coffee with us!

To everyone, we wish a fantastic start to 2025 🥂✨

title:
Jamming to Beethoven for the last production day of the year 🎻🎼

We’ll be back next year! 🤭

No, but seriously… what year, thank you! 🫶

Located in the heart of the historic center of Cascais, our Cascais store is the only one among our units that serves brunch with a sea breeze.

A mix of aristocratic architecture and a more traditional fishing heritage, Cascais is an unmissable tourist destination. One hour from Lisbon, the village is known for its fine sandy beaches and blue waters.

In the summer of 2022, we opened our first Cascais unit at number 26B Avenida Valbom. Just a short walk from the train station and the beach, this unit stands out with its wide, shaded terrace – a great spot to start the day with our Avo Toast and an espresso from our delicious Tero Farm.

We’d like to take this moment to send a big thank you to all the locals who have welcomed us with open arms from the start. Thank you for making our Cascais store a comfortable, friendly place where we always find familiar faces.

Last Call Subscription! 📩☕️

December is almost over, and with all the festivities and celebrations, we don’t want you to miss out on January’s subscription coffees.

To kick off 2025 in style, both the espresso and filter subscriptions will feature a microlot coffee – a small, carefully selected batch with unique characteristics that highlight the farmer’s skill and the specific growing conditions.

For Espresso: Natural, creamy, and fruity

Oromia Organic, Ethiopia: The natural processing of this organic coffee will bring a creamy and delicate espresso. You’ll notice strawberry and red fruit notes, which are typical of Ethiopian coffee.

Gisheke Microlot, Rwanda: This espresso microlot stands out for its fruity and funky flavor. A balanced, sweet, and full-bodied coffee, perfect for an espresso or a different milk-based drink.

For Filter: Washed and South American

Toliman, Guatemala: This washed coffee offers a clean and bright cup. With notes of nuts and a creamy texture, Toliman is the comfort food of coffees.

San Gabriel Microlot, Colombia: This filter microlot is a great example of a delicate coffee. With floral and vanilla notes and a light malic acidity typical of green apples, it makes an excellent V60.

Join our subscription by December 31st to receive these freshly roasted coffees on January 6th.

💡We’ve just published the second article on our blog!

Inspired by the familiar dilemma of wanting to enjoy a cup of coffee after dinner without losing sleep—or settling for a poor-quality decaf—we wrote this article to explain the Mountain Water Process.

This natural, chemical-free, eco-friendly decaffeination method preserves the full flavor of coffee, as showcased in our organic Santa Fé decaf.

You can find the full article on our website, along with Santa Fé decaf available in our online store.

Holiday Schedule alert! 🗓️

Dear everyone,

To ensure our teams get the rest they deserve, our shops will be closed on December 25, with adjusted hours on a couple of other days.
Here are our holiday hours to help you plan your visits:

December 24th: 08:00 to 13:00

December 31st: 08:00 to 13:00

January 1st: 09:00 to 15:00 (Truck is closed)

You can find all our locations through the link in our bio and check which of our shops is closest to you!

title:
We teamed up with one of our expert baristas to create a bulletproof espresso recipe for our Christmas Coffee Blend. Here’s the result:

1. Grind 18.8 g of the Christmas Coffee Blend. We used grind size number 2 on our @sageapplianceseu Smart Grinder Pro.
2. In 28 seconds, we pulled a 40 ml double espresso using our @lamarzocco Linea Mini.
3. Enjoy the delicious caramel and chocolate notes in your coffee or latte!

Use this recipe as a starting point and adapt it to the gear you have. Or visit our website to explore all our coffee gear options and level up your espresso and coffee rituals!

Located on Avenida Dom Carlos I, our café stands out for its excellent natural light and calm, relaxed atmosphere.

The Santos neighborhood, situated between Cais do Sodré and the Tejo River, is known for blending the traditional architecture of Madragoa with more modern buildings closer to the river. Considered a trendy area with its design stores, art scene, cultural activities, museums, and galleries, it still retains a welcoming and family-friendly energy.

In this vibrant setting, we opened our Santos location in the winter of 2021. Whether you prefer soaking up some sun on the small esplanade while enjoying your coffee or relaxing indoors, you’ll find fresh pastries, coffee bags to take home, a variety of drinks, and expert advice from our excellent baristas.

Oh, and it’s worth mentioning: your four-legged companions are always welcome in all our locations, including Santos!

A big shout-out to our Santos team, friends, and loyal regulars!

title:
We just kicked off blog season!🗒️✨
Our first post dives into a fundamental question: “Why is specialty coffee more expensive than regular coffee?”

Whether you’re already a fan of specialty coffee or trying to explain its advantages to a friend, this question tends to come up.

That’s why we’ve put together a blog post exploring the key steps of the coffee journey, the people who make it all happen, and the meticulous quality controls involved in the coffee lifecycle.

Head to our website blog to read the full article and discover some great reasons to keep enjoying specialty coffee.

Buy local, buy fresh.

Find Fábrica Coffee Roaster at the Cascais Market every Wednesday, Saturday, and Sunday from 8h30 to 14h.

We’ve been part of the Mercado da Vila de Cascais family for a while, but it’s never too late to remind you of what you can find at our kiosk:

Espresso and milk drinks: Choose from our specialty coffee options, including espresso, cappuccino, or americano, to go and enjoy your drink while you shop for your veggies and goods.

Caffeine-free options: For those visiting the market with kids or who prefer to stay caffeine-free, we offer organic decaf, and prana chai.

Sourdough bread and fresh pastries: What pairs better with a flat white than a fresh pain au chocolat? Every morning, our bakers prepare fresh and delicious pastries as well as long-fermented sourdough bread. You’ll find it all at our kiosk.

Coffee bags and expert advice: At our stand, you’ll find a variety of specialty coffee bags. Whether you prefer espresso or filter roast, ground or whole bean, you can choose your favorite to take home. If you’re looking for something different or a special gift you can always ask our trained baristas for recommendations, they’ll be happy to help.

Visit us at Mercado Vila Cascais to grab a coffee and support your local farmer’s market, guaranteeing fresh, high-quality products while supporting small businesses.

News 🚀

Introducing a unique collaboration between our brand and Lisbon’s ceramic studio, Arca ceramic, presenting the exquisite Handmade Mug. Crafted with meticulous attention to detail, this artisanal piece boasts a comfortably rounded handle, ensuring a delightful drinking experience with every sip.

Its captivating beige to natural hue is adorned with royal blue, vibrant blue, yellow, and red pencil strokes, concealed beneath an irregular, yet enchanting, glassy glaze. Each stroke of color tells a story, making every mug a one-of-a-kind masterpiece.

Limited to just 12 mugs in stock☕️ promises to add a touch of craft and artistic touch to your daily coffee or tea ritual. @arca_ceramica

You can find available at Santos shop and online!

#specialtycoffee

PORTO | RUA JOSÉ FALCÃO 122

The street is full of bookstores, for lovers of good food, and drink or who simply like to enjoy a quiet moment of their day.

In the summer of 2018, Fábrica took a huge step in opening its first store in Porto, where this city became our second home. A more spacious and charming store, with a beautiful interior garden, natural light, and high ceilings for you to enjoy a good coffee or brunch.

If you are a lover of good books and coffee, you would like to know that after taking your coffee at Fábrica, you can visit the oldest Portuguese bookstores and the most beautiful in the world, Livraria Lello, which is located near our store. 

If you want to learn more about specialty coffee, make sure you visit Fábrica at Porto and learn a lot from our friendly staff.

Open everyday
from: 8:30 am ‑ 6:30 pm

#specialtycoffee

@claytonbarrossa Junho, 2022
🥇 2 x COFFEE OF THE YEAR

A fazenda @cafefazendaninhodaaguia pertence a Clayton Barrossa, produtor de café brasileiro que vem investindo em técnicas sustentáveis de cultivo e colheita, como a colheita seletiva manual e a utilização de adubos orgânicos e bioestimulantes para promover o crescimento saudável das plantas.

Além disso, a fazenda Ninho d'Águia oferece uma experiência turística para os visitantes, com trilhas ecológicas, observação de aves e degustações de cafés especiais produzidos na propriedade.

O café dele está sempre disponível na nossa coleção de cafés especiais para amantes de filtro. Pode sempre encontrar nas lojas por Lisboa e Porto e também online. Temos vindo a trazer os micro lotes através de amigos nossos da @fafcoffees

title:
EXCITING NEWS! ✨

We're on the lookout for a talented manager to lead our seven bustling cafes in Lisbon and Cascais. The position starts on May 2nd, 2023.

As the chosen candidate, you'll be responsible for managing our cafes' daily operations, and we're seeking someone with full availability as our shops are open every day. We're looking for someone with a strong commitment to this role, and we expect you to be a part of our team for at least two years, helping us to grow and thrive sustainably.

If you're interested in joining us, please send your application to jobs@fabricacoffeeroasters.com, including a motivational letter and CV. Applications in either English or Portuguese are accepted, and please make sure to mention "Area Manager" in the subject line.

We can't wait to hear from you! Don't forget to apply before April 7th, 2023!

FILTER COFFEE

♥️☕️

Café des Mamas is a coffee with aromatic notes of herbs and dark chocolate, with a clear citrus acidity, and a light elegant body.
first_comments: ['The best 👌 🔥']

title:
**NEW** - CAFÉ DES MAMAS, RWANDA 🇷🇼

For filter coffee lovers, we have a new arrival!

Cafe des Mamas is a coffee with aromatic notes of herbs and dark chocolate, with a clear citrus acidity, and a light elegant body.

This coffee is grown in the volcanic mountains of the northern province of Rwanda, where the plant’s growing conditions are ideal thanks to the high altitudes, excellent soils, and favorable climate.

The Nova Coffee project is proudly run by Rwandan women and committed to female education, they hand select and process the coffee beans using the harvest method.

In the Café des Mamas, you can clearly taste Rwandan girl power. Grown with love by great farmers, enjoy it!

You can order to your door step and soon in our stores!

title:
Believe us: the correct grind can make all the difference in the taste of your coffee!

Check our photos and see why this process is so important when you are going to prepare your coffee. After proper grinding, the result will be an aromatic drink, with a complete taste, in which acidity, sweetness, body, and bitterness are in harmony.

You can also visit our blog (link in bio) and see our material about the grinding process.

Tell us, do you know how to grind your coffee at home?

Love is in the small details, so we took care of all details for you to enjoy this special date with your favourite person! We prepare two blends to celebrate and share with you our main love: coffee! 💓

P.S. I Love You is a Espresso Blend 70% Brazil and 30% Ethiopia, with notes of bergamot, chocolate and nuts.

You Are The One is a Filter Blend 70% Brazil and 30% Colombia, with notes of strawberry, honey and red berries. This delicious blends are made especially for you to surprise your special one! 🎁

Our blends are available in our online shop and soon in our physical stores!

title:
Cupid called… he says you’re about to win Valentine’s Day with a chocolate heart 💕🍫 Here’s how to pour the perfect one! ⁠
⁠
1. Start by mixing the cocoa powder with a splash of hot water ⁠
⁠
2. Give it a gentle swirl to spread the base and create a lovely crema ⁠
⁠
3. Pour the milk from a height, in a circular motion, to create a smooth base ⁠

4. To pour the heart, lower the pitcher’s nose close to the surface. Pour in small, steady bursts, then lift and cut through ⁠
⁠
5. Serve with love and watch their heart melt ⁠😉

🎥: @rubn.andrade

title:
Healthy habits starts with rye bread 🍞🤎 ⁠
⁠
As many of us kick off the new year with healthier habits, rye bread is the perfect addition to your routine. Not only does it taste amazing, but it’s also a nutritional powerhouse, packed with essential vitamins, minerals, and fiber ✨ ⁠
⁠
Here are just a few of the potential health benefits 👇⁠
⁠
✅ May boost heart health
⁠
✅ Supports digestive health ⁠
⁠
✅ Helps keep you fuller for longer
⁠
✅ Can aid in blood sugar control⁠
⁠
At CCL, we’ve got all your rye bread cravings covered - from wholesome loaves and soft buns to crispy rye chips and even homemade granola made from leftover rye bread to minimize waste 🌱 ⁠
⁠

title:
DISCOVER OUR NEW ETHIOPIAN FILTER COFFEE ☕️🇪🇹⁠
⁠
We are excited to continue our partnership with the Danche Washing Station and introduce a new chapter in our journey. This time, we have transitioned from washed to natural processing, creating a completely new and unique flavour profile ✨⁠
⁠
Thanks to slow maturation at high elevations, alongside steady and intricate drying on raised African beds, this coffee now boasts exceptional sweetness and complexity 🙌⁠
⁠
Diima Danche offers a rich, fruity sweetness, reminiscent of strawberry chocolate, watermelon and milkshake, complemented by subtle notes of hazelnut and lavender 🍓🍉🪻 ⁠
⁠
To celebrate its launch, join us for a free tasting tomorrow from 15:00–18:00 at our shop on Strandlodsvej in Copenhagen. ⁠Plus, for a limited time, enjoy 20% off this incredible coffee online! ⁠
⁠

title:
Snapshots from Bacalhoeiros 💙⁠
⁠
Our café in Bacalhoeiros is not only beautiful but also full of history! ⁠
⁠
The building, once called 'Casa das Varandas,' dates back to the 16th century and was lovingly restored after the 1755 earthquake. ⁠
⁠
You will notice how the mix of old and new styles creates a unique vibe, blending the charm of different eras. ⁠
⁠
We have kept the best of the past while adding our own personal touch, so you can enjoy a little taste of history with every visit ☕🏛️✨⁠
⁠
📸 @rubn.andrade ⁠
⁠
⁠#copenhagencoffeelab#cphcoffeelab#coffee#specialitycoffee#roastery#coffeeroastery#bakery#artisanbakery#danishbakery#bakeryshop#lisbon#lisboncoffee

title:
🎉 Happy New Year from all of us to all of you 🎉⁠
⁠
On this final day of the year, we want to take a moment to say a heartfelt thank you to our amazing customers for the many wonderful moments, smiles and stories we have shared over the past year. Your ongoing love and support means the world to us 🥹☕️ ⁠
⁠
As a way of paying tribute to you, we have gathered some of the beautiful photos you have shared with us over the course of the year 📸 These snapshots from your visits truly reflect the heart of what we do, and we are beyond grateful to have been a part of these moments ❤️ ⁠
⁠
As we look ahead to a new year, we are filled with gratitude and excitement for what’s to come. We can’t wait to continue growing, learning and creating even more great memories with you in 2025 💫 ⁠

We wish you and your loved ones a year filled with happiness, health and joy! ⁠
⁠
See you on the other side 🤗⁠

Rye bread is a Danish staple and of course also plays a starring role around Christmas 🎄 ⁠
⁠
In Denmark we have something called "julefrokost". It’s a beloved Danish Christmas tradition where friends or family gather around the table to enjoy a festive, multi-course lunch. The feast typically starts with fish dishes - like pickled herring and smoked salmon - and then moves on to meat courses 🐟🍗 ⁠
⁠
And, of course, no julefrokost would be complete without rye bread! It serves as the perfect base for all the delicious toppings ✨⁠
⁠
We bake our rye bread with real sourdough, long fermentation and a whole lot of love, making sure it’s the perfect companion to your holiday traditions - or everyday lunches 🫶 ⁠
⁠
What’s your favourite way to enjoy rye bread? Let us know in the comments!⁠
⁠
⁠#copenhagencoffeelab#cphcoffeelab#coffee#specialitycoffee#roastery#coffeeroastery#bakery#artisanbakery#danishbakery#bakeryshop#ryebread#rye ⁠

We have saved you a seat around our Christmas table 😉☕️🎄 ⁠

Introducing our PS Blend – a delightful fusion of rich chocolate, walnut, and caramel flavors that dances on the palate ✨ With a medium-heavy body and a smooth mouthfeel, this coffee is crafted from high-altitude beans that thrive in the embrace of nature ⛰️ ⁠

RECRUITMENT EVENT: COFFEE AND CAREER TALK IN HAMBURG 🇩🇪⁠
⁠
Thanks to the incredible love and support from our local community, Copenhagen Coffee Lab is getting busier than ever - and we’re looking for passionate new team members to join us! ☕️⁠
⁠
Come by for a relaxed and friendly open house event where you can enjoy a great coffee, chat with our team about career opportunities, and of course, show us what you're all about. Everyone is welcome, regardless of experience and background – we value diversity and can’t wait to meet you!⁠
⁠
We also offer a fun chance to get behind the bar and try making your own coffee ✨⁠
⁠
We are currently hiring for the following positions: Store Managers, Full-time, part-time and students. ⁠
⁠
📅 When: Wednesday, October 23rd ⁠
⏰ Time: 10 AM - 6 PM⁠
📍 Where: Copenhagen Coffee Lab, Kleiner Schäferkamp 58
⁠
No need to prepare anything in advance – just bring your CV and your love for coffee.⁠
⁠
If you’re unable to attend, feel free to send your CV to: info.ham@cphcoffelab.com ⁠
⁠
We look forward to meeting you! ⁠

title:
Are you searching for a unique and flavourful cup of coffee? ☕️✨ ⁠
⁠
Look no further than our Danche coffee! This exquisite blend starts with delicate notes of chamomile and lavender, leading you on a delightful journey through candy, plum, and peach 🌼🍑

Grown in the rich, fertile red soil of semi-forested regions, Danche showcases the floral and fruity elegance that defines washed Ethiopian coffees, resulting in an incredibly deep, clean, and dynamic flavour profile 🤍 ⁠
⁠
Head to our webshop (link in bio) to grab your bag of this incredible coffee! ⁠
⁠

title:
Great bread can’t be rushed! 🥖 At Copenhagen Coffee Lab, each loaf and bun is the result of over 48 hours of meticulous fermentation, resting and sourdough magic. This results in baked goods with a perfectly textured crust, a beautiful colour, and a juicy, acidity doughy centre 🤤⁠
⁠
Our craft takes time, patience, and love 💛 So when you enjoy one of our fresh bakes, know it’s been carefully nurtured every step of the way. ⁠
⁠
#copenhagencoffeelab#cphcoffeelab#coffee#specialitycoffee#roasters#coffeeroastery#bakery#artisanbakery#danishbakery#bakeryshop#sourdough#bread

DISCOVER FINCA CEYLAN 🤍

Tucked away beneath the towering volcanoes of Atitlán lies the enchanting Finca Ceylan – a wild organic land, flooded with biodiversity, fruit and lush coffee plants 🌿🦋⁠
⁠
The bourbon varietal gives a naturally heavy body and lends itself to an espresso with a playful apple acidity. With hints of pistachio, blood orange, and caramel, every sip invites you to discover something new ☕️✨⁠
⁠
As you sip this espresso, allow its vibrant character to whisk you away to the wild landscapes and untamed flavours of Guatemala 🇬🇹 ⁠
⁠
Ready to experience Finca Ceylan for yourself? Head to the link in our bio to order these exceptional coffee beans and bring the taste of Guatemala to your home! 🌎 ⁠
⁠

title:
Who doesn’t love a good Sunday brunch? ☕️🥞

Yesterday we visited @cphcoffeelab in Santos, Lisbon for a weekend brunch and we LOVED it! The atmosphere was perfect for a relaxed weekend afternoon, but also for remote working on weekdays 💻✨ Decor was modern & clean with big windows and looots of natural light ☀️

We started with a Cold Brew ☕️🧊 and a Passion Fruit Pineapple Juice 🍍 because the weather was very warm and then we had our classic favourite: Cappuccino 🤎 We highly recommend you tasting this last one.

Some other goodies we tasted and that we highly recommend too:
- Waffles 🧇 with 🍌 & Nutella 🌰
- Croissant 🥐 with ham & cheese 🧀
- Salted Caramel Brownie 🍫
- Peanut 🥜 Banana Muffin
- And the star of the Copenhagen Coffee Lab for us: Cinnamon Bun ⭐️

We even brought another Cinnamon Bun home with us 🥹 because it was too good to have just one!

Have you ever been to any of Copenhagen Coffee Lab’s locations? 📍☕️

title:
Journey into the heart of our roastery 🤍⁠
⁠
We don’t see ourselves as just coffee suppliers - rather, we’re proud coffee lovers on an endless journey to honour the bean ☕️ Our travels take us far, primarily to Africa and Central America, where we work closely with skilled farmers to handpick the finest beans and build lasting, meaningful relationships 🧑‍🌾 With deep knowledge and care, we roast and pack each batch of coffee daily at our roastery in Copenhagen, ensuring every cup reflects our dedication to quality ✨⁠
⁠

#copenhagencoffeelab#cphcoffeelab#coffee#specialitycoffee#roastery#coffeeroastery#latterart#latte#bakery#artisanbakery#danishbakery#bakeryshop#cake#carrotcake

New packaging, same great coffee ☕️⁠
⁠
A little while back we changed the packaging for our coffee beans, and we’ve been meaning to share it with you guys here on social media! We wanted our new design to reflect our roots, so we gave the packing a clean, laboratory-inspired look with elements drawn from the periodic table 👩‍🔬But it’s not just about aesthetics - this change is also part of our ongoing journey to become greener and more environmentally friendly, and we’re proud to say our coffee bags are now 100% recyclable ♻️ ⁠
⁠
As we continue to push for more, we’ve also revamped our to-go cups, which are now 99.24% plastic-free—but more on that later! 😉⁠
⁠
Thank you for joining us as we work toward a more sustainable future, one cup at a time! 🌍⁠
⁠
📸@rubn.andrade ⁠
⁠
#copenhagencoffeelab#cphcoffeelab#coffee#specialitycoffee#roastery#coffeeroastery#bakery#artisanbakery#danishbakery#bakeryshop#coffeebeans#packaging#sustainability#recycling

title:
HAVE YOU VISITED US IN ALFAMA? 🤍 ⁠
⁠
Nestled in the heart of Alfama, amidst a maze of narrow cobbled streets and traditional houses, you will find our cozy haven. ⁠
⁠
From the outside it might not look like much, but step inside and you will find yourself in a cozy, atmospheric space with stunning stone arches and a secret garden in the back 🌿✨⁠
⁠
Whether you're seeking a quiet escape, a spot to catch up with friends, or just a break from your Alfama adventures, Copenhagen Coffee Lab is here for you. Come, get lost in the beauty of Alfama, and find yourself in our little corner of calm 🤗 ⁠
⁠

title:
RECRUITMENT EVENT: COFFEE AND CAREER TALK IN COLOGNE 🇩🇪

Hello Cologne,

We’re excited to announce that we’re expanding our brand in Germany and we’re on the lookout for passionate new team members to join us at Copenhagen Coffee Lab ☕️

Join us for a relaxed and friendly open house event where you can enjoy a great coffee, chat with our team about career opportunities, and of course, show us what you're all about. Everyone is welcome, regardless of experience and background – we value diversity and can’t wait to meet you!

We also offer a fun chance to get behind the bar and try making your own coffee ✨

We are currently hiring for the following positions: Full-time, part-time and students.

📅 When: Wednesday, August 14th
⏰ Time: 10 AM - 7 PM
📍 Where: In our café by the cathedral (Am Hof 38-46)

No need to prepare anything in advance – just bring your CV and your love for coffee.

Sounds interesting? Head over to our Facebook event to sign up and stay tuned for updates! 👉 https://www.facebook.com/share/gPNpunL8PLDxP3eR/?mibextid=9l3rBW

Bis bald!

first_comments: ['dm❤️', 'Hej Copenhagen Coffee Lab Team, ich war heute mit einer Freundin in der Rindermarkthalle und wir haben einen Kaffee getrunken. Was wir dort erlebt haben , macht mich immer noch sprachlos. Wir bestellen unsere Kaffee 2 Latte Macciato bezahlen uns wird gesagt der Kaffee wird uns an den Tisch gebracht. Bis dahin alles gut. Wir setzen uns in 2 gemütliche Sessel , auf der Sitzbank liegt ein junger Mann, seine Füße mit Schuhen hat er auf dem Kissen abgelegt auf dem eure Gäste eigentlich sitzen sollen. Daneben sitzt noch ein Kumpel von ihm Ok denke ich vielleicht ist er betrunken oder ihm geht es nicht gut. Nach 10 Minuten wir haben immer noch keinen Kaffee, brüllt ein junger Mann in unsere Richtung bekommt ihr noch Kaffee ? Ja sagen wir und denken ok vielleicht hat er es vergessen kann ja mal passieren . Nach weiteren 6 Minuten fragen wir nach wo unser Kaffee bleibt und was da so lange dauert , die Antwort die kommt , es dauert nun mal so lange. Der junge Mann der auf der Bank liegt steht auf schlürft hinter den Tresen und wir merken er ist ein Mitarbeiter von euch . Mittlerweile stehen 3 junge Männer hinterm Tresen und immer noch kein Kaffee. Und dann der Hammer der zweite junge Mann der bei uns saß schlürft auch hinter den Tresen. Jetzt sind sie zu viert. Vor dem Tresen stehen 2 Menschen die etwas bestellen wollen. Also kurz gesagt es war nichts los. Nach geschlagenen 25 min haben wir unseren Kaffee bekommen der auch noch lauwarm war. Ich bin ehrlich , dies war das letzte mal das ich nach meinem Einkauf dort eine Pause gemacht. Ich dachte ihr müsste mal darauf aufmerksam gemacht werden. Ich denke nicht das solch ein Verhalten in eurem Sinne ist. Schöne Feiertage ✌🏻']

title:
From green coffee beans to that first sip of delightful coffee ☕️

A long and complicated process that we take care of every day, so you don’t need to give it a single thought 💁🏽✨

Our diverse range of coffees need constant care to ensure that you’re given an exceptional experience every day, whether that be in a busy espresso house, a batch brew in the office, or a pour-over at home.

We’ve created our own unique approach to coffee assessment, focusing on clarity of terroir, balances of sweetness and acidity and the tactility of the drinking experience.

We could write pages and pages about our process, but in the end we think that the taste speaks for itself.

So take a break from your thoughts and enjoy all the flavour notes of your coffee ☕️🤎

Check out our coffee selection via our Link in Bio 👆🥰

#SpecialityRoasters #SpecialityCoffee #SpecialityCoffee #CoffeeRoasters #CoffeeLovers #CoffeeShop #CopenhagenFood

The beauty of patience 🤍 Did you know that our bread and buns are over 48 hours in the making before hitting the shelves?⁠
⁠
Fermentation and resting time is essential for the outcome when baking bread with sourdough. Getting it right every single day is only possible when we continue to stay curious about the process. We’re always chasing the best possible outcome for our bread and baked goods, which is why we check and adjust temperatures, fermentation process and resting times every single day! 🌡️🕙🧑‍🍳⁠
⁠
But don’t worry, you don’t have to be patient to enjoy the taste of fresh sourdough bread and buns! Find your local Copenhagen Coffee Lab via the Link in our bio 🤳⁠
⁠
Maybe we’ll see you soon? ⁠
⁠
#ArtisanBakery #ArtisanBaker #SpecialityCoffee #Sourdough #SourdoughBakers #SourdoughBread

title:
We're looking for passionate BAKERS and DRIVERS in Ruhr, Germany, to make sure our shelves and displays are always filled with delicious baked goods! 👀⁠
⁠
BAKERS 🥖⁠
⁠
Are you passionate about artisan baking? Maybe you've even completed a baking education? If so, you’ve come to the right place! ⁠
⁠
As a BAKER at Copenhagen Coffee Lab, you will be responsible for preparing a wide range of baked goods and ensuring that the products meet our high standards in taste, appearance, and quality. Your attention to detail and commitment to delivering consistently outstanding products will significantly contribute to the success of our bakery. ⁠
⁠
We are constantly seeking dedicated and enthusiastic new colleagues to strengthen our production teams in Ruhr. ⁠
⁠
DRIVERS 🚚⁠
⁠
We're also on the lookout for DRIVERS who are passionate about safe driving and customer service, who is ready to take on the challenge and assist us in delivering our delicious baked gods. ⁠
⁠
As a DRIVER, you will play a crucial role in delivering our freshly baked goods to our chain of high-end cafés. Your primary responsibility will be to ensure timely and safe packaging and transportation of bakery products while maintaining the highest standards of professionalism and service for our colleagues in the bakery and cafés.⁠
⁠
REACH OUT⁠
⁠
If you have the motivation and skills and would like to be a part of a strong teamwork, we would love to hear from you!⁠
⁠
Read more about the position as BAKER and DRIVER on our website. You can apply via the website, or by sending an email to ck@cphcoffeelab.com⁠
⁠
📸 @lynn_pelikan⁠
⁠
#ruhrjob #kölnjob #essenjob #düsseldorfjob #bakeryjob #artisanbaker #artisanbakery #driverjob

Are you our new QUALITY MANAGER or KEY ACCOUNT MANAGER?☕️

If you're located in Denmark and have a great passion for coffee, you might be exactly who we're looking for!⁠ 👀
⁠
OM STILLINGERNE: ⁠
⁠
Vi søger to kandidater til vores team i København. Begge roller, henholdsvis QUALITY MANAGER og KEY ACCOUNT MANAGER, vil skulle tilbringe tid på landevejen, derfor er kørekort en nødvendighed. For begge positioner søger vi desuden en person med erfaring fra kaffebranchen - gerne med dygtighed inden for kaffeudstyr. ⁠
⁠
HVAD KAN VI TILBYDE? ⁠
⁠
✔️ En spændende arbejdsplads med dygtige kolleger og rig mulighed for at udvikle dine kompetencer inden for kaffebranchen. ⁠
⁠
✔️ En fuldtidsstilling med fast løn og pensionsordning. ⁠
⁠
✔️ En bil stilles til rådighed i arbejdstiden. ⁠
⁠
⁠
HVEM ER VI? ⁠
⁠
Copenhagen Coffee Lab ApS er et kafferisteri og bageri med hovedsæde i København samt caféer i Danmark, Tyskland, Portugal og Frankrig. Vi har eksisteret siden 2013, men i 2021 åbnede vores nye risteri i Sydhavn, og siden da har vi ristet på en Loring S70 Peregrine. ⁠
⁠
SKAL DU VÆRE EN DEL AF TEAMET?⁠
⁠
Læs mere om begge stillinger, herunder deres konkrete arbejdsopgaver, på vores hjemmeside. ⁠
⁠
Send dit CV og en kort motiveret ansøgning senest den 30. september 2023 til Allan Nielsen (allan@cphcoffeelab.com) eller ansøg via formularen på vores hjemmeside 🧑🏻‍💻
⁠
Begge stillinger ønskes besat pr. 1. november 2023. Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig. ⁠
⁠
📸 @kayae_olsen
⁠
#jobkøbenhavn #københavnjob #qualitymanager #kam #kaffejob #specialityroasters #coffeelovers

title:
Who doesn't want to be the office hero? 🦸⁠
⁠
Getting back to work after a long summer is never easy. But it's our mission to make it as enjoyable for you as possible! 👩‍💻💕⁠
⁠

We have a variety of filter and espresso, that'll make you and your colleges excited to get that first cup of coffee at the desk each morning ☕🌇⁠

We even do solutions for companies who want the full setup with machines, regular coffee sendings and service 📦🔧⁠

Bom dia! We're thrilled to announce that our new café in Lisbon at Rua dos Bacalhoeiros 6A is finally open! 🎉⁠
⁠
We're beyond excited to welcome you at our Bacalhoeiros café in this beautiful part of Lisbon, just by the sea 🌊🐟

This building, formerly known as 'Casa das Varandas', has a long history 🏨 It originally dates back to the 16th century but was rebuilt in the 18th century after suffering great damage during an earthquake in 1755. However, during the rebuilding process in the 18th century, the architects and craftsmen carefully preserved and integrated some of the original structures, giving the space an enchanting blend of architectural styles from different eras 🧱🔨
⁠
We wanted to honor the long history of the place by keeping as much of its historical charm and details as possible.⁠
⁠
We warmly invite you to join us for a delightful taste experience, complemented by the cultural richness of the surroundings ☕🏛️⁠💙
⁠
Come visit us at Bacalhoeiros from 8:00-21:00. We can't wait to see you there! ⁠
⁠
📸 @rubn.andrade⁠
⁠

title:
From oven breakdown to a triumphant comeback! 🔥

Just as the weekend approached, our beloved oven in Lisbon decided to take an unexpected break 🫠
But our resourceful staff refused to let this dampen their spirits. They tirelessly searched for a temporary solution, and though smaller, it was enough to keep our culinary dreams alive 🥹🫶

Today, we're overjoyed to share the news that our oven is now back in action, rejuvenated and ready to bake up a storm! 🌟

It's all thanks to the incredible determination of our team. Their unwavering commitment to excellence and their ability to turn challenges into triumphs never ceases to amaze us 🙌❤️

Thanks to everyone for your patience! We’re so happy to be back with our full range of bread and pastries 🙏

📸 @andersjeppesenphotography

#artisanbakery #bakerlife #lisbonfood #successstory #teamwork💪 #bakerylife #copenhagencoffeelab #copenhagencoffeelablisbon

title:
Looking for inspiration? ✨⁠
⁠
If you're in Lisbon looking for a place to go for inspiration, Alcântara is not a bad place to look. The area has an interesting mixture of industrial buildings and beautiful classical architecture - and has become one of the most trendy places in Lisbon. The area is homebase for a lot of urban artists, which is also reflected in the décor of our cafe on Rua Prior do Crato 1a. ⁠
⁠
The beautiful artwork in our Alcântara cafe is made by @vanessateodoro 🙌 Go check out all her amazing work on her IG!⁠

title:
Sometimes we get the question: "Why all the fuss - coffee is coffee right?". A fair question - but we respectfully disagree 😉 ⁠
⁠
To us coffee is not something to just chug down (even though that's completely valid too - we've all been there!). To us every cup of coffee is an opportunity to care - for yourself or others. We make coffee that'll make you wanna take that extra moment to yourself, to be present and really experience the flavors. ⁠
⁠
We do that because we think everyone deserves to have these little moments of self care throughout the day - even during a busy one. ⁠
⁠
Who would you like to treat to a cup of coffee? 🥰⁠
⁠
📷️ @rubn.andrade⁠
⁠

Did you know about our 'secret' garden in Alfama? 🌿 ⁠
⁠
Everyone who's been to the Alfama district in Lisbon knows that it's a great place to explore and go on adventures. You never really know what awaits just around the next street corner 🔎⁠
⁠
Our Alfama cafe is one of those places that people sometimes stumble upon when exploring the streets of the oldest district in Lisbon. ⁠
⁠
From the street it might not look like much, but when you enter the cafe you're suddenly in an old and atmospheric room with big stone arches. A place that almost makes you think that you're in a different time 🕯️⁠
⁠
Then when you move further into the cafe, you'll notice a green yard in the far back. A little oasis to enjoy your coffee or lunch whilst charging up for more adventures ☕️🌿⁠
⁠
See you soon in our 'secret' garden? ⁠
⁠
📷️ @rubn.andrade⁠
⁠
#secretgarden #visitlisbon #visitlisboa #lisboafood #lisboncafe #alfama #explorelisbon⁠

Meet the people of Copenhagen Coffee Lab 👋

Today we’d like to introduce you to our Head Barista in Lisbon, Portugal 🇵🇹 Gabriel is the type of person who spreads love wherever he goes. He’s fiercely passionate about coffee in a way that inspires everyone around him ✨

He’s originally from Brazil but discovered his love for coffee almost 10 years ago when he was staying in Australia. The love for coffee runs in his family, and he treats everyone who shares this passion as though they were family as well ☕️💖

Gabriel knows everything worth knowing about coffee - although he probably will argue that there’s always more to learn 🙌 We honestly don’t know where we’d be without him! 🤷

So many bread options for spring lunches! ☀️

Whichever ones you choose they are all made with a classic approach to the craft, using long fermentation and genuine sourdough 🥖🍞

The long fermentation combined with the sourdough makes it possible to get a crispy crust, a beautiful color on the bread, and a juicy, sourdough-like crumb. This is what we strive for in every bread we make.

What’s your favourite bread for a light spring lunch?

title:
Today we opened our brand new cafe on Fuhlsbüttler Strasse 132 in Hamburg ☀️ Thank you so much to everyone who has stopped by already! 🫶

Fuhlsbüttler Straße is a bustling street located in the heart of Hamburg, known for its unique blend of tradition and modernity.
If you come by, you’ll find a wealth of shopping, restaurants, and bars that all contribute to making this street one of the most popular places in Hamburg.
Fuhlsbüttler Straße offers everything you need to have a great day out. You can shop, eat and drink, relax, or simply observe the vibrant atmosphere of the street. And from today you can also enjoy Copenhagen Coffee Lab!

We’re so excited for this new location and hope to see many of you very soon 🥰☕️

📸 Jan-Ole Hoffmann

title:
GIVEAWAY ENDED - The winner has been announced 🎉

🏆 31X BREAD GIVEAWAY (worth 178 euro) 🏆

(Only for residents of Mülheim, Germany) 

Win 1 free bread every day for a month!
To celebrate our lovely German community we are giving away 1x 31 bread loafs of your choice worth 178 euro.

All our loafs are produced using long- and cold fermentation and sourdough. 

You can choose between all our classics such as: 

🍞Sourdough bread
🍞Spelt bread
🍞Nordic bread
🍞Soft grain rye bread
🍞Chia rye bread
🥯Brioche bread
🥖Ciabatta baguette

How to enter the giveaway:
✔️Follow our profile 
✔️Like the post 
✔️Comment who you want to share the prize with

This is not a requirement but will make us happy:
☝🏼 Share or tag your friends and family 
✌🏼 Visit our website and become a lab member
🤟🏼 Subscribe to our online newsletter

Entries will close at 23:59PM the 3th March and the winner will be contacted directly via direct message from this account. Winner will be randomly selected. 

* This competition is not sponsored, endorsed, administered by or associated with Meta.

1️⃣ For German residents only.
2️⃣ The prize must be redeemed in Mülheim (Düsseldorfer Straße 81, 45481 Mülheim an der Ruhr, Germany.

Thanks for all your love and support. 
Good luck 💗🙌🏼

Time is the key ingredient in all of our bakeries 🕟️ Good sourdough bread can't be rushed, so our bread is always at least 48 hours under way ✨⁠
⁠
Every day we make sure to carefully check and control our temperatures, resting and the long fermentation process. All of which takes time, but is so worth it in the end when biting into that textured crust and juicy, acidic doughy centre.⁠
⁠
⁠📷️ @shashank_pandav
⁠
⁠

title:
A little photo/video dump from last weeks Coffee Conference where our Head Baristas came to the Roastery in Copenhagen to take a deep dive into the world of coffee ☕️✨

On the agenda we had activities such as Sample Roasting, Espresso dial in, Quality Control and Cupping - just to name a few, as well as lots of discussion and analysis.

Thank you so much to our dedicated colleagues who came all the way to Copenhagen and brought so much great energy and passion to the event 🫶 We’re grateful for all the incredible work you do to keep the coffee tasting amazing in each and every cafe and bakery!
A huge shout out to our roasters Sarah and Joe for putting together the event, and bringing everyone together to taste some beautiful coffees 🙌

#specialitycoffee #specialitycoffeeroasters #specialitycoffeeshop #coffeeconference #baristalife #baristadaily #coffeelovers #coffeeroaster #coffeelover #coffeedaily #espressomachine #espressolab #espressolove #filtercoffeelove #coffeelisbon #coffeeshop #coffeeeducation #kaffeeliebe #cafecannes #copenhagencoffeelab #coffeecopenhagen

Calling everyone who lives in the district of Ruhr! 📣 Help us find an international name for the danish pastry ‘Fastelavnsbolle’! 😍

Since posting about the danish pastry ‘Fastelavnsbolle’ last week, we’ve experienced a great interest from our community in Germany to have the pastry there as well! We’ve listened to your request and is therefore introducing the pastry in the Ruhr district 🙌

We do need a little bit of help though finding the right name for it! We’re looking for a name that’ll work in our french and portugese cafes as well, as we’re expecting to be launching the pastry in all cafes within the next three weeks 🤩 The person who comes up with the name we end up using can go to their local CCL cafe to pick up six ‘Fastelavnsboller’ to take home 🥰

Please write your suggestion in the comment section or send us a DM! 🌟

About the ‘Fastelavnsbolle’:
The ‘Fastelavnsbolle’ is a sweet bun with custard filling that is baked and enjoyed during the Scandinavian Carnival season that takes place in February.

• This giveaway is in no way sponsored, endorsed, administered or associated with Instagram.
• The winner will be contacted in DM within 72 hours after this post.
• The winner must be able to pick up the prize in Ruhr, Germany.
•The value of the prize is estimated to 15€

Have you ever been to our cafe at Strandlodsvej in Copenhagen? The cafe is located near Amager Beach in a new and vibrant area of Copenhagen. We've recently updated the interior of the cafe - but have kept the same cozy atmosphere that's always been characteristic for the place.⁠
⁠
We're currently looking for more staff under the age of 18 for the cafe, so if you're a young coffee enthusiast, we would love to hear from you!⁠
⁠
Please send an email to cphslv@cphcoffeelab.com if you're interested. ⁠

Meet Jacob Karlsen and Allan Nielsen, two of the four founders of Copenhagen Coffee Lab.

They share a long history together, which started when they were only three years old. Since then, a lot has happened including different projects such as Kalles Kaffe and Copenhagen Coffee Lab. Watch the video to hear more about their journey and why they fell in love with the third wave coffee industry.

Watch the video and much more by following the link in bio.

title:
O nosso Spring Blend está de volta, com um design inspirado na flor de Sakura 🌸

A sua mistura de cafés provenientes da América Latina e da Ásia-Pacífico, com um sabor suave e delicado, é ideal para a primavera, devido à sua versatilidade para ser preparado tanto quente como frio. ☕

Vai ficar surpreendido com as suas notas de honeybush - um arbusto sul-africano primo do Rooibos - e o seu final persistente de cacau, juntamente com as suaves notas de frutas tropicais que proporcionam um sabor subtilmente doce.

title: Qual é a bebida que mais lhe define no verão? 😎 Conte-nos👇🏻#summer #summervibes #summertime #refresha #frappuccino #icedcoffee
first_comments:
['Estou bastante desiludida com vocês.
Antes sempre na compra de um tumbler, e este ano já o tive por duas vezes, ofereciam uma bebida a escolha.
Tive dia 29 de junho na loja em que ao comprei o tapa tumbler e uma bebida e comentei com a menina que atendeu que até ia a procura de um copo que já não tinham em loja ao que a menina comenta que já esgotou e eu comento que a pouco tempo (a até ano) tinha descoberto que na compra de um tumbler tinha direito a bebida e a menina comentou que tinha sempre direito a bebida e que avisavam sempre mas no passad, no natal, tinha comprado um e nem me deram essa informação logo perdi a bebida desse copo.
Por isso agora pergunto como é que já uma semana atrás a funcionária informa que tem sempre direito a bebida e que informam e hoje dizem ahhh não agora só com as estrelas. Acho que uma coisa não devia ter haver com a outra', 'Refresha', 'Iced Latte!!! 😍😍', 'Aqu em Portugal também há a bebida da Barbie?', 'Tem que abrir uma loja em aveiro', 'Frappuccino caramelo ou cookie', 'VEM PRA VIANA DO CASTELO !!!!', 'Cold brew, mas com adição de caramelo 🫶🏻', 'Pink refresha 😍', 'e se for um iced latte? 👀👀', 'Hot Caramelo Macchiato SEMPRE 🔥❤️', 'Iced Caramel Macchiato']

title:
WIN the ultimate Costa Coffee x Tassimo bundle this Christmas! ☕ 🎄
And it doesn’t stop there! The festive bundle will include your very OWN Tassimo Finesse machine alongside a selection of Costa packs to get you through the winter:
❄️Costa Americano (x12)
❄️Costa Latte (x6)
❄️Costa Cappuccino (x6)

How to enter:
1️ - Like this post. 🩵
2️ - Tag 3 friends who would LOVE Tassimo. 👯‍♀️
3️ - Make sure you’re following @tassimo_uk and @costacoffee. 🫵
4️ - Reshare this post on your story. 🔁

T&C’s apply. Giveaway closes at midnight on the 12th December. Winners will be contacted via @tassimo_uk. Ages 18+ UK only.
We will DM the selected winners once the competition has closed*.
We will only ever contact you from @tassimo_uk if you win. We will never ask you for postage payments.
Please be aware of scammers and do not respond to any accounts other than our account mentioned above regarding this giveaway.

Full T&C’s below:
*This giveaway is open to residents of the UK who are 18+ at time of entry. Incomplete or noncompliant entries will not be counted. One (1) winner will receive one (1) Tassimo Finesse Machine alongside three (3) Tassimo Packs - Costa Americano (x12) Costa Latte (x6) Costa Cappuccino (x6) prize pods will need to be available from Tassimo | The prize is non-transferable, non-exchangeable, and no cash alternatives will be offered. The winner will be selected at random for all eligible entries received by the closing date and will be notified via Instagram direct message within 3 days after the end of the Giveaway. If the winner cannot be contacted, is not eligible, or does not claim the prize within 5 days of notification, Tassimo reserves the right to withdraw the prize and pick a replacement winner.

To enter the Giveaway, participants must:
• Like the giveaway post
• Follow @tassimo_uk and @costacoffee on Instagram
• Tag 3 friends on the post
• Reshare the post on their story
Entries must be received by 23:59 on 12th December 2024
Winner will be drawn on the 13th of December

title:
An update for our Costa Club members 📣

Some of you may be experiencing issues with the Costa app logging you out and not being able to login again. This is due to an issue with a global service provider affecting many businesses including us. While we're unable to fix it directly, we're closely monitoring the situation. Rest assured, your account, personal information and Beans balance are safe and we appreciate your patience.

Thanks

Costa Club Team ☕️

We can’t wait for the Big Early hosted by @CostaCoffee!

Kicking off the festival spirit a day early, Costa Coffee will be bringing:

🎉 A range of fun-filled activities and entertainment
🤡 Face painting
🎾 Giant garden games
🎧 TikTok DJ @snowdreammusic at the Silent Disco

Also lined-up are:

🤣 The Dad Jokes vs Kids Crackers battle
📖 Bedtime Stories hosted by the Evans Family
🎤 The Kids Party with Disney Singalongs and Greatest Showman’s Show
🔥 Campfire Classics with the Basingstoke Gang Show
🫧 Lots of bubbles and fun

Don’t forget to join the Costa Club via the Costa Coffee app ahead of arrival to access exclusive areas and win great prizes.

title:
🎉WIN A £250 COSTA COFFEE VOUCHER AND POP-UP TICKETS🎉

That’s right, we’ve teamed up with @costacoffee to give you the chance to win a £250 Costa Coffee voucher and two tickets to their brand-new Unbelieva-bar pop-up 🎟️ Don’t say we don’t treat ya..

What’s so special about this pop-up? We hear you ask. Well, they’ve created the world’s first hot milkshake. Imagine your favourite chocolate milkshake but instead of it giving you brain freeze, you’re warm and cosy 🥰 Try this incredible concoction, play fun games, learn unbelievable facts AND you’ll have the chance to win £500. Ka-ching 🫰

Four runners-up will be selected and each will win a £25 Costa Coffee voucher and two tickets to the Unbelieva-bar 😛 We like those odds, don’t you?

To enter:
💜 Like this post
🏷️ Tag a mate in the comments (one entry per person)
📱 Follow @designmynight and @costacoffee

Competition closes on 5th February at 11:59pm. T&CS apply.

title:
Costa Coffee has been up to something unbelievable…🧋

They’ve created the world’s first hot milkshakes (yes, for real) and you can try them at their brand-new pop-up in London, The Hot Milkshake Unbelieva-bar 🥛 But you’ve got to be speedy as it ends on 10th February 🏃‍♀️

Tickets include entry to the experience, a hot milkshake of your choice and the chance to win £500 💸

Head to our 🔗 in bio to grab your tickets now.

📍 Unbelieva-bar by @costacoffee

Tag #DesignMyNight to be featured.

first_comments: ['Bring back the coronation chicken toastie. It was the best 😍', "Dear Costa,\nI am writing this following a very upsetting experience I had in one of your cafes today. My daughter is 5 years old and she has a dairy allergy. She enjoys eating the vegan ham and cheese toastie you sell. I should mention at this point that that toastie is the only lunch item she can eat from your entire menu. The only option she has due to her having an allergy not because shes making a choice to be vegan. Today after school I gave her a few options of places to eat as a treat. She chose Costa as she really wanted a vegan cheese an ham toastie. However, When we arrived we were told that the only vegan/allergen free option available to her had been removed from the menu for the festive period. Disappointed would be a massive understament. She was absolutely devasted and as her mum I felt gutted for her. Unlike most people who can eat a normal diet and have many options from your menu she didn't have another option so not only was she upset to find it wasn't available anymore she was upset because she was hungry and there was nothing for her to eat. Of all the things you could swap for the festive menu why remove the one vegan/ allergen option? There is a large portion of the population who suffer from allergies now and heavily rely on these options when eating out and large percentage of these are children. How do you explain to a child there is nothing on the menu for them to eat? first_comments: ['This coffee is awful. It tastes worse than tescos own brand', 'This coffee is great to start with but because it doesn’t dissolve you have a gritty end of coffee taste yuk', 'Oh- so you care about mothers, aye? Why then do you partake in separating mothers from their babies? That is torture to mother cows- they cry for days after their babies are taken away. STOP USING DAIRY', 'My fave instant coffee, just wish you still did my shop fave Almond milk latte 😢', 'Time to #madeitbetter by only offering plant-based milk milk for human consumption if you truly care about your customers as Cows milk is unhealthy.check out @vivacharity investigation of the horrific farm where Costa cows milk is coming from 🤢', '😍😍', '😍😍❤️', "Is there any offers 4 mother's day", '@gittehv', 'i prefer hot chocolate 🍫', '😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍', 'Think of the hardest working mother: the dairy cow. She gives birth after being artificially impregnated by a human stranger. Her baby is snatched away from her so humans can take the milk. At only a few days old the female baby is fed by a machine. While her mum grieves, she’s impregnated again. She’s genetically modified to hold 100% increase in litres of milk. Too much for her to stand. She suffers lameness and after this cycle of never being with her baby, she’s slaughtered. Costa dairy milk comes from this type of factory farm. Mothers’ Day is a reminder to each of us, to choose plant milk in our coffee. Male calves are shot at birth or transported in trucks to be killed as veal. Costa dairy suppliers have been investigated for severe cruelty to cows on the factory farm. Never forget these mothers. If you love/loved your mother or if you are a mother, choose plant milk options. Join @vivacharity follow @petauk @plantbasednews and enjoy watching @cowspiracy @gamechangersmovie @wthfilm @forksoverknives and Earthlings on Netflix. Try it. title:
Want to star in our billboards across the UK and win free Costa for a month? Simply share a picture where we've made your day a little better, tag @CostaCoffee in the picture and use the hashtag #MadeALittleBetter

We'll turn it into a poster and send you a video so you can share it with the world! ☕️❤️️

T&C: costa.co.uk/terms
first_comments:
['You may not have heard of Home Farm, but you have heard of Costa Coffee. Home Farm supplies Freshways, who provide milk to Costa Coffee, one of the nation’s largest coffee shop chains.Viva! Campaigns uncovered rampant cruelty at Kent’s Home Farm dairy and we enlisted your help to expose the abhorrent reality of dairy farming to the British public.

Viva! Campaigns investigated Home Farm in Kent after a tip-off. We were horrified by what we found there – but what happens here happens on thousands of farms across the UK, every single day. We found cows that were emaciated, lame and struggling to walk, others manhandled, slapped and shoved, and yet more visibly injured or in shackles.

This is modern dairy farming! It’s unacceptable that animals are treated like this in 21st century Britain. https://viva.org.uk/animals/campaigns/the-true-costa-dairy/ #animalcruelty #plantmilk #stopharminganimals', 'Thousands of cows lives would be #madealittlebetter if you ditched dairy.', 'Y are there no Friday offers anymore?', '❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️Amazing how can I get this', '😍😍', 'Will you notify us if it happens?', '@kimrotheram', 'Hi i have just seen a lady on here say you are recalling pink heart mugs! Despite paying extra for special delivery (Which meant that the order was meant to arrive in 10-15min), I got a phonecall from a vacant sounding person 30 min later saying she has no rocky road which is a vegan snack. She offered to substitute it with a vegan brownie. I asked her 3 times if it was vegan as I'm lactose intolerant. Yes she said definietly vegan and dairy free.

title: Start your Monday morning strong 💪
first_comments: ['Absolutely humiliated after my visit with my baby to Costa Deptford store. I asked for a Baby Chino and was angrily told No I have to buy something and bare in mind I’ had a very distressed toddler in my arms. As a mum I couldn’t believe how hostile she was she ignored me and served the two people behind me I stood there as she prepared there orders I felt humiliated whislt trying to kindly ask please can I just have some milk was faced with her shouting at me that they don’t give milk and then she banged around making the milk and then pushed it on the surface and said here in front of everyone. A white man then said to her why would you treat her like that it’s disgusting it’s for the baby. I simply replied how much for the milk and then she said oh just take it. title: Proudly Canadian. Supporting and serving Canadians from coast to coast to coast since 1964. 🇨🇦
first_comments:
['Heck yes ❤️🙌', 'Omg can you pleeeeease make more vegan options 🫶🤭😭 I CAN HELP YOU!!! (Heart if you agree!) ❣️', 'Hi Tim H, I had to write. Just bought donut and noticed how the quality of TH has changed for the worst. I want to like you but your coffee is like water and donuts are never fresh.', 'I thought you’re Brazilian now?', 'Please come to Brazil 🇧🇷!!! ❤️🇨🇦', 'Please, come to France 🇫🇷🥤🇨🇦 😍', "Proud to be Canadian.'' great taste of coffee the best . Boo,,,, USA .", "I'm a proud American who loves Canada, hockey, and Tim's.❤", 'Thank you for supporting Canadian Dairy Farmers 🩵', 'I am Brazilian and Tim Hortons had been with me on an unforgettable one-month journey through Calgary in 2005! I will never forget your hot coffees!', 'Buy second cup instead if you want to support 🇨🇦', '😢The Tim Hortons brand is American owned (A Burger King Co.) but a majority of the franchises in Canada are owned by Canadian families.😢', 'I just spent half an hour researching this and it seems that for every $1 spent with you, more of it goes to the USA than Canada.

Yes, suppliers are local to Canada. Yes, Franchisees are Canadian. And yes you do pay Canadian corporate taxes. But, Burger King and your other brands are much larger, meaning more of total company revenues go towards the USA than Canada. And, because you’re only somewhat owned by Canadian shareholders, the overwhelming majority of profits gets paid out to American investment firms and your Brazilian owned 3G capital. Basically Canadian money funds non-Canadian expansion while the profits are siphoned away from Canada.

So yes, you’re Canadian operated, you’d have to be to operate in Canada. But that’s true of McDonalds and any brand that has physical presence in Canada. You’re otherwise no more Canadian than them, or any other brand, besides your branding itself.

I recommend anyone reading this to, where possible, support actually Canadian owned brands, not Tim Hortons.

I do however wish I were wrong- so if there’s someone I’ve missed, please correct me.', 'You should be sued for false advertising. Tim Hortons is not and has not been a Canadian company for a long time', 'We are grateful for the incredible support of Tim Hortons in the Burlington community!']

EARTH DAY GIVEAWAY 🌎🌱☀️🌿

This year, make a difference by rescuing food from @timhortons on the @toogoodtogo.can app, bring your own cup, and cut down on waste—all in one trip. 💚❤️

10 WINNERS WILL GET:
🌱 A $300 Too Good To Go gift card
🌱 A $400 Tim Hortons Gift Card
🌱 A 40oz Tim Hortons Travel Tumbler
🌱 A Tim Hortons t-shirt
🌱 A Too Good To Go Tote Bag

To enter:
👉 Follow @timhortons and @toogoodtogo.can
👉 Like the post
👉 Comment your favourite Tim Hortons baked good and tag a friend you’d like to share your next Surprise Bag with

Contest closes on April 22 at 12PM EST and winners will be DM’d by @toogoodtogo.can

No purchase necessary. At least 18 (19 in BC) and a resident of BC, AB, MB, SK, ON, NB, NS, PEI, and NL. Odds of winning dependent on entries received. Winners will be chosen at random and will be asked a skill-testing question before receiving their prize. Promotion is in no way sponsored or associated with Instagram. @timhortons is blessing us with yet ANOTHER amazing Flatbread Pizza and let’s just say it’s one you definitely want to try!

The 3 Meat Hat-Trick Flatbread Pizza: saucy, loaded with toppings on their soft yet crispy Flatbread Pizza base.

Garlic Bread: their new side item that can honestly stand on its own! Cheesy goodness on top of a soft garlicky pull- apart bun

Peach Lemonade Quencher: IYKYK. Any Tims meal is not complete without this delicious drink to wash it all down! Perfect for any season!

Today, and every day, we’re celebrating you.

title:
Special Olympics athlete Julia Romualdi tells Lainey about her involvement in Special Olympics as a figure skater, soccer player, as well as an Athlete Leader. Julia has introduced Special Olympics Unified Sports programs to high schools in her hometown of Timmins, Ontario to give more opportunities for participation and inclusion of students with intellectual and developmental disabilities. Tim Hortons is once again supporting that goal with the return of the Special Olympics Donut, available from January 31 to February 2. 100% of proceeds from sales of the donut will support community sport programs for more than 42,000 Special Olympics athletes across the country.

#TimHortons #SpecialOlympics #SpecialOlympicsDonut #ChooseToInclude

title:
Growing up below the poverty line came with many challenges, but one of my positive childhood core memories was attending @timscamps

It’s so much more than just a regular camp, as it’s geared towards providing youth from low income families and underserved communities the opportunity to grow into our best selves 🙌🏻

Through programs like Camp Day, your generous donations help raise funds for Tims Camp - so it wouldn’t be possible without your support! I’m just full of gratitude and reflection, and I’m excited for more kids to go to camp, just like I did.

title:
Since 1975, @timscamps have helped to support over 325,000 youth aged 9 – 16 from underserved communities unlock their potential. Each year, your generous donations from Camp Day, Holiday Smile Cookie and yearlong initiatives like Round Up on our mobile app or in-restaurant coin boxes, help raise funds to support and run all year-round programming for youth. Tims Camps are so much more than just a camp. They challenge young people. They help them see their best self. And they work with them as they carve a path towards the future they want.

For more information on @timscamps visit www.timscamps.com.

title: In July 1975, the first Tims Camp opened in Parry Sound, Ontario. Today, there are 7 locations across North America, offering more underserved youth with experiences that go beyond your average summer camp; teaching them courage, resilience, self-esteem, communication, and building lifelong friendships along the way. We’ve been able to work with over 325,000 youth to date, and we’re just getting started. ❤️

title:

🟠 Gord Downie & Chanie Wenjack Fund
🟠 Ulnooweg Education Centre
🟠 Indian Residential School Survivors Society
🟠 Foundation Nouveaux Sentiers
🟠 Orange Shirt Society

title:
Hey Canada! It’s time to announce the next Timbits Player of the Month. Meet Lorenzo!  👋 
 
Age: 7
Hometown: Winnipeg, MB
 
Fun fact: Lorenzo’s middle name is Fun! He’s enjoyed the new friendships that have come with being part of the Timbits Hockey program over the last two years and is always excited to go to the rink. 🏒
 
Every month, we’re highlighting a player who embodies the core values of Timbits Sports: teamwork, sportsmanship, inclusivity, and (last but not least) having fun! It’s a great way to celebrate your Timbits achievements!
 
If you’d like to submit a player, go to www.timhortons.ca/timbits-sports #TimbitsSports #TimbitsHockey #HockeyPlayers #Hockey #Tims #TimbitsPlayerOfTheMonth
